items.title: RT by @youyuxi: In the latest version of Oxfmt (better prettier replacement): ‚Ä¢ oxfmt --migrate prettier ‚Ä¢ oxfmit --init ‚Ä¢ oxfmt --stdin-filepath for pipe usage ‚Ä¢ Node.js API ‚Ä¢ Sort package.json fields by default ‚Ä¢ Respect root .editorconfig Give it a try:
items.content_text:
In the latest version of Oxfmt (better prettier replacement):

‚Ä¢ oxfmt --migrate prettier
‚Ä¢ oxfmit --init
‚Ä¢ oxfmt --stdin-filepath for pipe usage
‚Ä¢ Node.js API
‚Ä¢ Sort package.json fields by default
‚Ä¢ Respect root .editorconfig

Give it a try:

‚Ä¢ https://t.co/O68UNpWalD‚Äî Boshen (@boshen_c) December 19, 2025
items.content_html:
In the latest version of Oxfmt (better prettier replacement):

‚Ä¢ oxfmt --migrate prettier
‚Ä¢ oxfmit --init
‚Ä¢ oxfmt --stdin-filepath for pipe usage
‚Ä¢ Node.js API
‚Ä¢ Sort package.json fields by default
‚Ä¢ Respect root .editorconfig

Give it a try:

‚Ä¢ https://t.co/O68UNpWalD

‚Äî Boshen (@boshen_c) December 19, 2025

items.title: RT by @youyuxi: Want to append or prepend content to your files? Then you can use `postBanner` and `postFooter` in @rolldown_rs now! The difference to `banner` and `footer`: The content will be added AFTER minification, making sure that comments are not removed Try it in our REPL‚Ä¶
items.content_text:
Want to append or prepend content to your files? Then you can use `postBanner` and `postFooter` in @rolldown_rs now!

The difference to `banner` and `footer`: The content will be added AFTER minification, making sure that comments are not removed

Try it in our REPL‚Ä¶ pic.twitter.com/qRjoClkaBz‚Äî VoidZero (@voidzerodev) December 18, 2025
items.content_html:
Want to append or prepend content to your files? Then you can use `postBanner` and `postFooter` in @rolldown_rs now!

The difference to `banner` and `footer`: The content will be added AFTER minification, making sure that comments are not removed

Try it in our REPL‚Ä¶ pic.twitter.com/qRjoClkaBz

‚Äî VoidZero (@voidzerodev) December 18, 2025

items.title: RT by @youyuxi: Want to understand why some of your @vitest_dev tests are slower than expected? Then you can use the built-in experimental @OpenTelemetry support to figure out what makes tests slow and how much time is spent on each part of it. üìà When enabled, Vitest will generate traces‚Ä¶
items.content_text:
Want to understand why some of your @vitest_dev tests are slower than expected? Then you can use the built-in experimental @OpenTelemetry support to figure out what makes tests slow and how much time is spent on each part of it. üìà 

When enabled, Vitest will generate traces‚Ä¶ pic.twitter.com/Jyz5if6Mjf‚Äî VoidZero (@voidzerodev) December 17, 2025
items.content_html:

items.title: RT by @youyuxi: Yes, @rolldown_rs is supporting Rollup's plugin API which is also the base of @vite_js plugins. But did you know that Rolldown also aligns with certain features from esbuild natively? In turn, you can use `define` and `inject` without any extra plugins. Just define them via your‚Ä¶
items.content_text:
Yes, @rolldown_rs is supporting Rollup's plugin API which is also the base of @vite_js plugins. But did you know that Rolldown also aligns with certain features from esbuild natively?

In turn, you can use `define` and `inject` without any extra plugins. Just define them via your‚Ä¶‚Äî VoidZero (@voidzerodev) December 16, 2025
items.content_html:
Yes, @rolldown_rs is supporting Rollup's plugin API which is also the base of @vite_js plugins. But did you know that Rolldown also aligns with certain features from esbuild natively?

In turn, you can use `define` and `inject` without any extra plugins. Just define them via your‚Ä¶

‚Äî VoidZero (@voidzerodev) December 16, 2025

items.title: RT by @youyuxi: Oxlint v1.33.0 & oxfmt v0.18.0 are out! üöÄ ‚Üí 14 new rules! ‚Üí RuleTester enhancements for custom plugins ‚Üí lots of formatter CLI! ‚Üí package.json sorting ‚Üí `quoteProps` support ‚Üí 11 perf improvements! ‚Üí 10 formatter & 16 linter fixes! ‚Üí more doc improvements!
items.content_text:
Oxlint v1.33.0 & oxfmt v0.18.0 are out! üöÄ

‚Üí 14 new rules!
‚Üí RuleTester enhancements for custom plugins
‚Üí lots of formatter CLI!
‚Üí package.json sorting
‚Üí `quoteProps` support
‚Üí 11 perf improvements!
‚Üí 10 formatter & 16 linter fixes!
‚Üí more doc improvements!‚Äî Cam (@Cameron_C2) December 15, 2025
items.content_html:
Oxlint v1.33.0 & oxfmt v0.18.0 are out! üöÄ

‚Üí 14 new rules!
‚Üí RuleTester enhancements for custom plugins
‚Üí lots of formatter CLI!
‚Üí package.json sorting
‚Üí `quoteProps` support
‚Üí 11 perf improvements!
‚Üí 10 formatter & 16 linter fixes!
‚Üí more doc improvements!

‚Äî Cam (@Cameron_C2) December 15, 2025

items.title: RT by @youyuxi: I had to show that feature in action and tell something about Hook Filters. Video up now on my YouTube channel üëÄ
items.content_text:
I had to show that feature in action and tell something about Hook Filters. The best is that it works framework-agnostic and gives great indicators without being a profiling pro.

It already helped improving perf in @nuxt_js. More to come.

items.title: RT by @youyuxi: Researchers have found two new vulnerabilities in React Server Components while attempting to exploit the patches last week. These are new issues, separate from the critical CVE last week. The patch for React2Shell remains effective for the Remote Code Execution exploit.
items.content_text:
Researchers have found two new vulnerabilities in React Server Components while attempting to exploit the patches last week.

These are new issues, separate from the critical CVE last week. The patch for React2Shell remains effective for the Remote Code Execution exploit.‚Äî React (@reactjs) December 11, 2025
items.content_html:
Researchers have found two new vulnerabilities in React Server Components while attempting to exploit the patches last week.

These are new issues, separate from the critical CVE last week. The patch for React2Shell remains effective for the Remote Code Execution exploit.

‚Äî React (@reactjs) December 11, 2025

items.title: RT by @youyuxi: ‚ú® Hot from the release press: When using @rolldown_rs and experiencing a slow build, you now see which plugins slow your build down! items.title: RT by @youyuxi: Announcing Oxlint Type-Aware Linting Alpha üéÅ Just a few months after our technical preview, type-aware linting reaches the alpha milestone! ‚ú® Type-aware rules can now be configured üôà Inline comments to disable rules work for type-aware rules too ‚úî Auto fixes for type-aware‚Ä¶
items.content_text:
Announcing Oxlint Type-Aware Linting Alpha üéÅ

Just a few months after our technical preview, type-aware linting reaches the alpha milestone!

‚ú® Type-aware rules can now be configured
üôà Inline comments to disable rules work for type-aware rules too
‚úî Auto fixes for type-aware‚Ä¶‚Äî VoidZero (@voidzerodev) December 8, 2025
items.content_html:
Announcing Oxlint Type-Aware Linting Alpha üéÅ

Just a few months after our technical preview, type-aware linting reaches the alpha milestone!

‚ú® Type-aware rules can now be configured
üôà Inline comments to disable rules work for type-aware rules too
‚úî Auto fixes for type-aware‚Ä¶

‚Äî VoidZero (@voidzerodev) December 8, 2025

items.title: RT by @youyuxi: Oxlint v1.32.0 & oxfmt v1.17.0 are out! üöÄ ‚Üí new rule: eslint/no-useless-return ‚Üí globals support for custom plugins ‚Üí fix support for type aware rules ‚Üí 7x formatter bug fixes ‚Üí 30+ linter bug fixes
items.content_text:
Oxlint v1.32.0 & oxfmt v1.17.0 are out! üöÄ

‚Üí new rule: eslint/no-useless-return
‚Üí globals support for custom plugins
‚Üí fix support for type aware rules
‚Üí 7x formatter bug fixes
‚Üí 30+ linter bug fixes‚Äî Cam (@Cameron_C2) December 8, 2025
items.content_html:
Oxlint v1.32.0 & oxfmt v1.17.0 are out! üöÄ

‚Üí new rule: eslint/no-useless-return
‚Üí globals support for custom plugins
‚Üí fix support for type aware rules
‚Üí 7x formatter bug fixes
‚Üí 30+ linter bug fixes

‚Äî Cam (@Cameron_C2) December 8, 2025
